title: "Lissandra players felt like they had no passive" EXCUSE ME? FREE MANA? WHAT ABOUT WUKONG'S 4 ARMOR?
body: Jesus fukin Christ, even the new champ has a better wukong's w, is this a joke?

replies.body:
The difference here is that Lissandra's mana costs were tuned much higher than average to compensate for her passive. It basically meant that you had to manage your passive *and* mana instead of just managing mana. Imaging Wukong had 10-30 lower base resists than every other fighter to justify his current passive. That's the gist of Lissandra's old passive.

That said, look at what happened to Liss this patch. Her new passive is 100% worthless in lane and 90% worthless in solo queue. They nerfed her -50 base damage and .2 AP. That's a bigger net loss than the recent nerfs to Akali, Leblanc, Graves, and Irelia *combined*. And they barely lowered her mana costs, so now she's just OOM all the time in lane. 

Don't even get me started on what happened to Zyra. What a fuckin' debacle.

You think you want a new passive but you don't. Take it from somebody who's been through this twice now. Wukong has a shit passive because it's low budget. If you want a better passive it's going to cost you something, like your ability to 1-shot things from stealth with zero counterplay. Or your freelo W scripts. Or the Lord Dominik's baked into your kit instead of having to buy it like everyone else. Or your Katarina ult with hard cc, but with movement and immunity to interrupt.

The moral of the story is this: if you cry too much about a passive, Riot will give you something to *really* cry about.

How many games have to watched or played from 8.23 PBE? I've seen 5 replays, and I can only recall seeing Lissandra's passive deal damage twice in those 5 games combined. It's so situational and so unreliable that the compensation nerfs just make her bad most of the time.

>Even in solo queue, if you and your team can't even kill at least 1 person while staying alive then you're team is already had a huge dis-advantage or just out-skilled and the game was probably over no matter what.

You're not thinking of this the right way. Imagine Liss goes bot for a gank. If the gank goes well, your team gets a double. A lot of the time both bot laners will be dead before your passive explodes. In the alternative, you nuke the support and the ADC just dashes away from the zombie. Or the zombie actually does explode and damages the ADC, but they still survive and recall anyway. No matter how you slice it, the passive is usually doing nothing and certainly not making up for 50 + .2AP in nerfs and a spectacularly weaker lane phase.

I also can't find the passive's range published anywhere. So who knows how many times you could go into the middle of a team and they scatter while you're in stasis and get out of range before dying. If the range is very long, that's a whole different story, but something tells me it isn't very long (guessing 1000 *max*).
